reviews.review: A great game and a great sequel.
very fun and cool game bouth it recently and i love how it is im happy that i was fanaly able to play it

Portal 2 Is a worthy successor to the original game and heavily improves upon it. First off, the graphics have been greatly improved making the game timeless in terms of visuals. Moreover, the gameplay has also been expanded by giving the player a few more tools to solve puzzles like the bouncy gel or the speedy gel. These new tools are limited to certain puzzles, however. puzzles are much more complicated as well making the game twice as hard than the first one. In addition, the game comes with a co-op mode where one and their friend can solve puzzles outside of the main game. The story is also greater than the one in the first game being even funnier and interesting having a few more characters instead of just having Chell and Glados again making the plot more engaging while also having a few plot-twists here and there. The only drawback in this game for me personally, was the final hour of the game forcing you to do a few dull puzzles that you really I just didn't really care about and wanted to finish quickly in order to get to the final bossfight.

overall a great experience and a must-play for anyone who is looking for something different
Rating: 9.2
Amazing story and smooth gameplay: 10/10 would recommend :)

The second installment of the Portal series and I have to give credit to Valve, they nailed it. A revolutionary FPS puzzle game, almost a decade old and it's still fun to play. If you want to kill time and show off your puzzle skills, then definitely play this game.

Portal 2 is a god damn masterpiece. While it is not my favorite game, it's definitely up there in my top 5, and it's also the OBJECTIVELY best game I ever played. This is an enormous step up from the first Portal, which, don't get me wrong, was fun, but it was really short and had its flaws. Portal 2 is way longer, more difficult, has more interesting and unique gimmicks, develops the story 30 times more than the first game did, has coop, AND workshop support with an in-game level editor. It is simply a blast to play, especially the coop campaign.

While Portal 2 is far beyond a masterpiece, as every other game, it does have it's flaws. Thankfully they're very minor, but it's still useful to point them out.
1. Some of the moments in the singleplayer campaign (especially chapters 6 and 7) have these segments revolving around exploring instead of solving puzzles. Which don't get me wrong, it's not a bad thing on its own, but it sometimes ends up with just brainless walking around trying to find that ONE portalable surface.
2. In Coop, there's no way to mute your mic. Yes you can mute your mic globally on your PC, but it's annoying being forced to talk through the game instead of using something like Discord, because you can't hear your partner when the game is loading or when you're looking at another window.

In conclusion, Portal 2 is a near-perfect game that everyone should play. I have yet to find a single person who hasn't enjoyed it, the whole negative review section is filled with fake negative reviews praising the game, and I've only read one serious negative review which the writer only recommend against the game because of their motion sickness.

Also the ending is really powerful, I was really happy after seeing it.

Final Score: 11/10. beyond a masterpiece.

Co-op is the strength of this game to this day, the single player is a great story however the levels are short with a loading screen after every one puzzle. It is quick loading screens so it's not too bad, just a small annoyance.

It was nice to play it with a friend. He is no longer my friend if that says something. 

Find a trustworthy ally (like me huh, bonus points for hunks) and put your friendship to the test  or die trying. 

Buying this for solo play is questionable. I wish I had more friends
